message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.EC. 

This paper deals with the problem of learning the most valuable item from a pool of items using sequential, adaptively chosen plays of subsets of items. This problem is related to machine learning and artificial intelligence, which suggests that cs.LG and cs.AI are likely sub-categories. The paper also involves the analysis of the complexity of separating pairs of items based on their relative win/loss empirical counts, which is related to data structures and algorithms, suggesting that cs.DS is also a likely sub-category. The paper also involves the analysis of the sample complexity of the learning algorithm, which is related to game theory and economics, suggesting that cs.GT and cs.EC are also likely sub-categories.
